Protagonist (Ambertwo).detailed_description:
*   The main character of the story.
*   A female Pokémon gamer from another world who died after being hit by a truck.
*   Reincarnated into the Pokémon world as a clone of Dr. Fuji's deceased daughter, Amber.
*   Initially disoriented and confused upon awakening in a cloning tank.
*   Expresses concern for Dr. Fuji's safety and recognizes the danger of the situation.
*   Currently in a child's body, implied to be around the same age as Amber was when she died.
*   Goes by the online handle "AlexaTheGreat".

facts.fact: The protagonist was a dedicated Pokemon player in her previous life.
The protagonist's online handle is AlexaTheGreat.

Dr. Fuji.description: Rescued by Dr. Fuji after awakening. The Protagonist recognizes him and his connection to the lab.

Mewtwo.description: Encountered Mewtwo shortly after awakening. Mewtwo's presence instilled primal terror in the protagonist.

Reincarnation/Isekai.description: The core premise of the protagonist's rebirth in the Pokemon world.

Dr. Fuji's Laboratory.description: Awakened in a cloning tank within the laboratory.

Amber (Original).description: The protagonist is a clone of Dr. Fuji's deceased daughter, Amber.

Protagonist's Death.description: The event that led to the protagonist's reincarnation.

Pokemon Emulator Game.description: The game the protagonist was playing before her death.

Dr. Fuji.detailed_description:
*   A brilliant scientist working in an underground laboratory.
*   Successfully cloned his deceased daughter, Amber, resulting in the protagonist's new body.
*   Implied to be involved in Mewtwo's creation.
*   Expresses joy and relief upon the protagonist's awakening.
*   Protective of the protagonist, shielding her from danger.
*   Determined to 'fix' their family and life.
*   Injured by falling debris during Mewtwo's rampage.

facts.fact: Dr. Fuji is injured by falling debris during Mewtwo's rampage, sustaining cuts and bruises.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: Rescues the protagonist after she awakens. Sees the protagonist as his daughter, Amber.

Mewtwo.description: Implied to be involved in Mewtwo's creation. Mewtwo's rampage endangers Dr. Fuji and the protagonist.

Dr. Fuji's Laboratory.description: Works and resides in the laboratory.

Amber (Original).description: Father of Amber, whose clone is the protagonist.

Escape from the Lab.description: Dr. Fuji helps the protagonist escape from the lab after Mewtwo's rampage.

aliases: Fuji's legendary clone (possibly referring to Mewtwo in overheard conversation)
Mewtwo.detailed_description:
*   A powerful, genetically engineered Legendary Pokémon.
*   Created in Dr. Fuji's lab.
*   Awakens violently, destroying the lab.
*   Possesses immense psychic power.
*   Briefly makes eye contact with the protagonist, causing primal terror.
*   Attacked by an Arcanine, but quickly retaliates.
*   Escapes the lab by blasting through the ceiling.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: Encountered the protagonist shortly after her awakening. Their eye contact caused primal terror in the protagonist.

Dr. Fuji.description: Created in Dr. Fuji's laboratory. Mewtwo's rampage endangers Dr. Fuji.

Dr. Fuji's Laboratory.description: Rampages through and destroys parts of Dr. Fuji's laboratory.

Shadow Mewtwo Raid.description: The protagonist was on her way to a Shadow Mewtwo raid before her death.

Escape from the Lab.description: Mewtwo's rampage causes a security breach and allows for escape from the lab.

Eye Contact (Protagonist & Mewtwo).description: The protagonist and Mewtwo make eye contact, freezing the protagonist in place with primal terror.

Reincarnation/Isekai.detailed_description:
*   The core premise of the story.
*   The protagonist dies in her original world and is reborn in the Pokemon world.
*   Specifically, the reincarnation occurs as a clone of an existing person (Amber).

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: The protagonist is the subject of the reincarnation/isekai.

Protagonist's Death.description: The event that triggered the reincarnation.

New World/Pokemon World.description: The world the protagonist is reborn into.

Dr. Fuji's Laboratory.detailed_description:
*   An underground research facility.
*   Where Dr. Fuji conducts his experiments, including cloning and genetic engineering.
*   Contains cloning tanks, labs (like Enhancement Lab Three), and an evolution acceleration chamber.
*   Partially disguised as a mansion.
*   Damaged and destroyed by Mewtwo's rampage.
*   Contains partially-formed Pokemon variants.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: The protagonist awakens in a cloning tank within the laboratory.

Dr. Fuji.description: Dr. Fuji works and resides in the laboratory.

Mewtwo.description: Mewtwo was created in and rampages through the laboratory.

Escape from the Lab.description: The setting for the escape sequence after Mewtwo's rampage.

Partially-formed Pokemon Variants.description: The laboratory contains partially-formed Pokemon variants in tanks.

Amber Fluid Tank.description: The protagonist awakens in an amber fluid tank within the laboratory.

Evolution Acceleration Chamber.description: Mentioned in overheard conversations, implying its importance to the facility's research.

Amber (Original).detailed_description:
*   Dr. Fuji's deceased daughter.
*   Her death is Dr. Fuji's primary motivation for his cloning experiments, particularly the creation of Mewtwo and the protagonist.
*   The protagonist is cloned from her DNA.
*   Dr. Fuji is desperate to revive her and "fix" their family.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: The protagonist is a clone of Amber (Original).

Dr. Fuji.description: Amber (Original) is Dr. Fuji's deceased daughter.

Shadow Mewtwo Raid.detailed_description:
*   A time-limited event in a Pokémon GO-like mobile game.
*   Features a Shadow Mewtwo encounter at the library gym on the protagonist's college campus.
*   The protagonist was rushing to participate in this raid when she was struck by a vehicle.
*   The raid was scheduled for March 30, 2024.

facts.fact: The raid was scheduled for March 30, 2024.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: The protagonist was rushing to the Shadow Mewtwo raid when she died.

Mewtwo.description: The raid features a Shadow Mewtwo encounter.

Protagonist's Death.description: The protagonist's pursuit of the Shadow Mewtwo raid directly caused her death.

Protagonist's Death.detailed_description:
*   The protagonist was struck by a vehicle while rushing to the Shadow Mewtwo raid.
*   Occurred while crossing University Avenue.
*   Her last thoughts were about her Gyarados in the paused game.

facts.fact: Her last thoughts were about her Gyarados in the paused game.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: The protagonist's death led to her reincarnation as Ambertwo.

Reincarnation/Isekai.description: The protagonist's death triggers her reincarnation in the Pokemon world.

Shadow Mewtwo Raid.description: The protagonist was rushing to the Shadow Mewtwo raid when she died.

Escape from the Lab.detailed_description:
*   Dr. Fuji rescues the newly 'born' protagonist (Ambertwo) from his laboratory.
*   Occurs amidst the chaos of Mewtwo's rampage.
*   The laboratory is in a state of destruction, with emergency lights, steam, and sparks.
*   They navigate through panicked scientists and security personnel.
*   Flames are beginning to spread through the facility.

facts.fact: Flames are beginning to spread through the facility.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: The protagonist is rescued by Dr. Fuji during the lab escape.

Dr. Fuji.description: Dr. Fuji leads the protagonist during the lab escape.

Mewtwo.description: Mewtwo's rampage causes the chaos that necessitates the lab escape.

Dr. Fuji's Laboratory.description: The escape takes place within Dr. Fuji's destroyed laboratory.

Partially-formed Pokemon Variants.detailed_description:
*   Unstable Pokémon creatures seen glitching in and out of reality within Dr. Fuji's laboratory.
*   One example is a Kadabra variant with too many fingers, leaving trails of psychic energy.
*   Suggests other failed or unstable experiments by Dr. Fuji.

Dr. Fuji.description: The partially-formed Pokemon variants are likely the result of Dr. Fuji's experiments.

Mewtwo.description: The variants exist in the same facility where Mewtwo was created.

Dr. Fuji's Laboratory.description: The partially-formed Pokemon variants are located within Dr. Fuji's laboratory.

Primal Terror/Instinct.detailed_description:
*   A deep, instinctual fear experienced by the protagonist upon making eye contact with Mewtwo.
*   Overrode her gamer knowledge and rational thought.
*   Triggered by Mewtwo's raw, primal power and existence outside the natural order.
*   Represents the protagonist's vulnerability in her new body and the overwhelming nature of the Pokémon world's reality.

Mewtwo.description: Mewtwo's presence and power trigger the primal terror.

Eye Contact (Protagonist & Mewtwo).description: Eye contact is the direct trigger for the primal terror.

Pokemon Emulator Game.detailed_description:
*   A Pokémon game the protagonist was playing on an emulator before her death.
*   Features perma-death rules, adding to the stakes and frustration of the protagonist.
*   Includes a Gyarados that the protagonist has carefully trained since it was a Magikarp.
*   The game's state is saved just before the protagonist leaves for the Shadow Mewtwo raid.
*   Represents the protagonist's past life, dedication to Pokémon, and connection to the Pokémon world.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: The protagonist was playing the game before her death.

Eye Contact (Protagonist & Mewtwo).detailed_description:
*   A moment of direct eye contact between the newly awakened protagonist and Mewtwo.
*   Causes the protagonist to freeze in terror due to Mewtwo's overwhelming presence.
*   Broken by an attack from an Arcanine.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: The protagonist makes eye contact with Mewtwo.

Mewtwo.description: Mewtwo makes eye contact with the protagonist.

Primal Terror/Instinct.description: The eye contact triggers the protagonist's primal terror.

Amber Fluid Tank.detailed_description:
*   A container filled with amber-colored fluid.
*   The protagonist awakens inside this tank in Dr. Fuji's lab.
*   The fluid feels thick and syrupy.
*   The tank shatters, releasing the protagonist.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: The protagonist awakens inside the tank.

Dr. Fuji's Laboratory.description: The tank is located within Dr. Fuji's laboratory.

Evolution Acceleration Chamber.detailed_description:
*   A piece of equipment mentioned during the lab escape.
*   Reportedly overloading during the events of the chapter.
*   Its purpose is implied to be related to accelerating evolution, possibly of Pokémon or clones.

Mewtwo.description: Potentially related to Mewtwo's creation or power surge.

Pokemon World (Pokemon: Ambertwo).detailed_description:
*   A fictional world based on the Pokemon franchise, now the primary setting for the protagonist's reincarnation.
*   Contains locations like Dr. Fuji's Laboratory and potentially others from the Pokemon games/anime/manga.
*   Operates under the rules and concepts of the Pokemon universe, including Pokemon, battles, and various technologies.
*   Currently experiencing a period of chaos due to Mewtwo's escape and the destruction of the laboratory.
*   The protagonist is now a part of this world, inhabiting a cloned body.

Protagonist (Ambertwo).description: The protagonist is now located in and a part of this world.

Dr. Fuji.description: Dr. Fuji resides and conducts research in this world.

Mewtwo.description: Mewtwo is a powerful entity within this world.

Reincarnation/Isekai.description: The protagonist's arrival in this world is due to reincarnation/isekai.

Dr. Fuji's Laboratory.description: A specific location within the Pokemon World where much of the current story takes place.
